subject: Education
title: Peer Learning: Children Teaching Children
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Peer Learning: Children Teaching Children.

hook.text: Students who teach other students learn the material twice as deeply. Teaching is the most powerful form of studying.

buildup.text: Peer tutoring works because the tutor must organize, explain, and check understanding â€” all high-level cognitive tasks.

discovery.text: Studies show peer tutoring benefits the tutor more than the tutee. Teaching forces you to truly understand the material.

twist.text: Children often explain concepts better than adults because they recently struggled with the same confusion.

climax.text: The best learning happens when children teach each other. Every student should be both learner and teacher.

punchline.text: The fastest way to learn something is to teach it to someone who doesn't know
